CHAT.comment: Book Reading; The Very Hungry Caterpillar

context notes say that Mot mouths the words as Chi reads and points at words he misses. She also helps him sound words out and is physically supportive. Chi isn't a great reader. Mostly he leaves words out. He doesn't use the pictures to help him get through the days of the week. Notes also say Chi is VERY focused and serious while reading. In the end Chi gets worn out and Mot feeds him the words (a wise choice considering the disastrous times I've seen where they tough it out no matter what). This is a very good example of handling mediocre reading.

u.a: whispered
reading at table Mot and Chi sit next to each other--both hold book . Mot looks over shoulder , mouths words as Chi reads , points at words he misses
softly , gently
very quietly
smiles when Chi finishes page
MOT leans close , points at word , slowly sounds it out
MOT points at word
quietly
MOT leans , points , sounds it out
Chi turns page; Chi totally focused on reading , very serious
MOT puts hand on Chi's head for a second for encouragement
MOT laughs quietly and points at piece
touches Chi's forehead , encouraging
MOT leans back and gives space
Chi has own hand on forehead , tenses up
Chi rubs face with fingers bends over book Mot leans back
sound of page turning loudly
MOT leans back toward Chi
MOT prompts from here to end , context notes say she seems a little impatient; Brenda says imagine if poor Chi had gone it alone !
MOT starts saying two weeks before Chi
way to go !
whispered
very elongated sounding it out
MOT leans back and lets Chi finish alone
